title: U.S. Stock Market Bullish On Small Caps Strength (But Overbought)
text: The S&P 500 fell 0.48% after digesting Mondays's rally due to positive additional COVID19 vaccine data. It closed today with a bullish intermediate confirmation signal.

title: The Russell 2000 Is Today's Stock Market “Spiderman”
text: The S&P 500 (SPY), Nasdaq 100 (QQQ), and Dow Jones Industrials (DIA) all closed under recent highs, while the Russell 2000 (IWM) was able to close over 178.10 making new all time highs. It's no easy feat for the small caps to outperform the major stock market indices, especially with the recent news of Tesla […] The post The Russell 2000 Is Today's Stock Market “Spiderman” appeared first on See It Market.

title: Weeks Of Weak Claims On Growing Claims Of Weeks Of Weak Demand
text: Massive QE, a "flood" of "money printing" since the middle of March, was supposed to have been hugely inflationary.

title: Cramer dishes on navigating through a confusing moment on the market
text: There are so many cross currents that it feels like the wind blows both ways at the same time, the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Did Value Wake Up Last Week?
text: The vaccine was far from the only catalyst for value's sharply higher week amid a tape that refused to reward growth-oriented Consumer Discretionary and Technology companies.

title: SEC Pushes Plan That Could Delist Chinese Companies
text: Nov.17 -- The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is pushing ahead with a plan that threatens to kick Chinese companies off U.S. stock exchanges. Tom Mackenzie reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.

title: Judy Shelton, Trump Fed Nominee, Fails to Advance to Final Vote
text: Ms. Shelton, a Trump loyalist with unusual views, hit a major setback. But her journey toward the Federal Reserve's Board of Governors may not be over.

title: Trading the market pullback: Where the opportunities are now
text: Nadine Terman, Solstein Capital CEO & CIO, on opportunities in China. With CNBC's Dominic Chu and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Dan Nathan and Karen Finerman.

title: Stock futures flat after pause in the record rally
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 fell for the first time in three sessions on Tuesday.

title: U.S. Markets Drop From Monday's Record Highs
text: U.S. equity markets snapped a two-day win streak as investors backed away from their recent buying frenzy, digesting sizable recent gains.

title: SEC Ready For Vote On Plan To Delist Chinese Firms
text: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is moving forward with a plan that could boot Chinese companies from U.S. stock exchanges, Bloomberg reported. The regulation, intended to be introduced before year's end, would have the effect of delisting companies for not following U.S. auditing rules.

title: Smaller Caps Are Still Looking Better (Technically Speaking For 11/17)
text: The markets are overbought on a short-term basis.

title: Markets Roll Back from All-Time Highs: WBA, WMT, KBH & More
text: This is the first down close in the last three sessions for the main indexes, which were once again outpaced by the small-cap Russell 2000.

title: This is going to be an uneven recovery even with the strong vaccine news: Strategist

title: We're excluded, it's not a good thing: Fisher on U.S.'s exclusion from Asia-Pacific trade agreement
text: China and 14 other nations signed one of the world's largest regional free trade agreements, called the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership. The U.S. is not in this deal, and former Dallas Fed president Richard Fischer joins ‘Closing Bell' to discuss what it means for U.S. trade relationships.

title: The backdrop for the market is extremely bullish: Eddie Ghabour

title: MoneyLine Podcast: Small Caps Are Joining the Rally — Why That's HUGE News
text: In today's MoneyLine podcast, Matt McCall explains the importance of the small-cap breakout, answers your investment questions and shares how to profit in today's stock market. The post MoneyLine Podcast: Small Caps Are Joining the Rally — Why That's HUGE News appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Stocks Sink On Worse-Than-Expected Retail Sales Ahead Of ‘Difficult Winter' To Come
text: Walmart and Home Depot both posted better-than-expected earnings before the opening bell, but shares fell on the broader market pessimism.

title: The real turning point for markets will be next February, March: Citi's Levkovich
text: Tobias Levkovich, Citi's chief U.S. equity strategist, predicts we'll see 3,800 on the S&P 500 and 34,200 on the Dow by the end of 2021. He joins ‘Closing Bell' to discuss.

title: Stock Market Today: Market's Spark Fades, But Fireworks Abound
text: The major indices followed Monday's raucous rally with a tamer, flatter Tuesday. The Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 0.6% off its record high to 29,783, while the Nasdaq Composite slipped by a thin 0.2% to 11,899.

title: US stocks fall from record heights as virus concerns persist
text: US stocks closed lower on Tuesday following record highs reached the prior day as investor concerns surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic lingered. Despite good news from Moderna and Pfizer on the vaccine front, daily COVID-19 cases remain on the rise and it the widespread availability of a vaccine is still months away.

title: White House confident Fed nominee Shelton will eventually be confirmed
text: The White House on Tuesday said it expected the U.S. Senate to eventually confirm Judy Shelton, President Donald Trump's nominee for the Federal Reserve, despite a vote to block her nomination earlier in the afternoon.

title: Stocks pull back from records to end lower as economic worries rise
text: Stocks ended lower Tuesday after data confirmed a slowdown in retail sales last month and COVID-19 cases continued to rise. The pullback came a day after the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 closed at records, in a rally propelled by continued progress toward a vaccine.

title: Big Tech Isn't the Key to Big Profits … This Is
text: Washington's regulatory “hammer” isn't now aimed at every tech company, and it would be foolish to abandon the entire tech sector because a few companies are being scrutinized. Make sure you stay on the right side of the 'Technocasm.

title: U.S. Senate blocks confirmation of Fed nominee Shelton
text: Ylan Mui joins 'Closing Bell' to report Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has stopped the process of confirming Fed nominee Judy Shelton for now.

title: US Indexes End Lower Tuesday
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 29,783.35 on Tuesday with a loss of 167.09 points or -0.56%. The S&P 500 closed at 3,609.53 for a loss of 17.38 points or -0.48%.

title: Shelton Fed nomination fails key Senate procedure vote, likely ending her chances
text: Judy Shelton's controversial nomination to the Federal Reserve suffered a possibly fatal blow Tuesday in a key procedural vote in the Senate.

title: U.S Senate blocks confirmation of Trump Fed nominee Shelton
text: The U.S. Senate on Tuesday blocked President Donald Trump's nomination of Judy Shelton to the board of the Federal Reserve.

title: 'Got a long way to go': Fed Chair Jerome Powell says it's too soon to say how much vaccines will lift the economy
text: Recent progress on developing coronavirus vaccines is "certainly good news," but the US economy is still far from returning to pre-pandemic levels of activity, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said Tuesday. Investors positioned for a sooner-than-expected economic recovery over the past week as data from Moderna and Pfizer and BioNTech's experimental vaccines showed strong efficiency in preventing COVID-19. The Dow Jones industrial average and S&P 500 closed at record highs on Monday, and investor capital continues to shift into cyclical sectors pegged to the economy.

title: The Long Road Narrative
text: If stocks are looking ahead, why is the market lower today?

title: Unfortunately this is a lost 2-year period on both economic and earnings growth: Clearnomics CEO
text: Clearnomics CEO James Liu discusses the outlook for stocks and the economy amid the coronavirus pandemic and news of COVID-19 vaccines. #coronavirus #stocks #economy Subscribe to Yahoo Finance: https://yhoo.it/2fGu5Bb About Yahoo Finance: At Yahoo Finance, you get free stock quotes, up-to-date news, portfolio management resources, international market data, social interaction and mortgage rates that help you manage your financial life.

title: It's 'Borderline Crazy' Not to Extend Fed Lending Program, Blinder Says
text: Nov.17 -- Former Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Alan Blinder, a Princeton University professor, says it's borderline crazy not to extend the Federal Reserve lending program. He also says Janet Yellen would be a good pick for Treasury Secretary.

title: Pgim's Peters Sees a 'Difficult inflation Regime' Going Forward
text: Nov.17 -- Greg Peters, Pgim fixed income head of multi-sector strategy, talks about his outlook for inflation and monetary policy. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: We'll see a lot of momentum change heading into 2021, but market will remain resilient: Liz Young
text: Liz Young, BNY Mellon Investment Management market strategy director and Steve Chiavarone, Federated Hermes portfolio manager and equity strategist, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss their market outlook heading into the end of the year.

title: Fed Chair Powell Says Coronavirus Surge Will Hurt Economy, Stimulus Needed Now More Than Ever
text: Powell said that despite promising vaccine news, ‘significant challenges and uncertainties' remain in the near term.

title: U.S. Treasury Yields Push Higher, Sending an Optimistic Signal to Investors
text: With a new administration taking shape, investors' optimism about a second round of stimulus and a Covid-19 vaccine could foreshadow the yield on the key 10-year Treasury breaking through the 1% mark in the coming months. title: S&P 500, Nasdaq Set To Lag, Russell 2000 To Lead
text: Both the S&P 500 Index and Nasdaq Composite are trading within target zones where investors can expect a pause or pullback to occur. These price areas very well may trigger the start of a broad stock market pullback.

title: Behind the rise of multi-class share structures
text: CNBC's Leslie Picker and Duncan Davidson of Bullpen Capital discuss the rise of multi-class share structures and what it means for investors. In recent years, companies have gotten more creative in shares sold.

title: Tesla Holds Up the Nasdaq; Costco Gets the Buffett Boot
text: Stock markets were down, but the Nasdaq was hit the least.

title: Fed's Powell Says Premature to Consider Normalizing Balance-Sheet
text: Nov.17 -- Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell says it is "premature to even think about" reducing the central bank's balance-sheet to historically normal levels. Powell speaks at the Bay Area Council Business Hall of Fame's virtual event.

title: The Fed: Powell says need for more fiscal spending is greater than it's been in a long time
text: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Tuesday made a fresh appeal to Congress to pass another coronavirus relief package to help troubled businesses and out-of-work Americans.

title: US retail sales stagnate amid COVID-19 surge
text: The recovery in US retail sales slowed last month as consumers confronted a surge in coronavirus infections and a lack of government aid to see them through the pandemic. Retailers' total sales rose just 0.3 percent to about $553 billion in October following September's 1.6 percent growth, the US Census Bureau said Thursday.

title: In One Chart: This chart shows traders are bringing forward their expectations for first Fed rate increase since pandemic
text: Traders in short-term funding markets now expect Federal Reserve rate increases earlier than before, following recent positive developments on the COVID-19 vaccine front.

title: For S&P 500, Tesla Inclusion Is A Risk
text: Although Tesla is large enough by market capitalization to warrant inclusion, its place on the list is a risk for the entire index.

title: Dow Jones Sinks Despite Strong Earnings From Walmart and Home Depot
text: Positive earnings news failed to provide a lift to the Dow.

title: The Technical Indicator: Charting the approach of Dow 30,000 as bullish sector rotation persists
text: Technically speaking, the S&P 500 and Dow industrials have concurrently registered record closes, rising amid still healthy market rotation and expanding sector participation, writes Michael Ashbaugh.

title: Despite Buffett Bullishness, Stock Markets Are Falling
text: Find out what the Oracle of Omaha's company has been buying lately.

title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell speaks at Bay Area Council Business Hall of Fame event —11/17/20
text: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell speaks Tuesday at the Bay Area Council Business Hall of Fame awards ceremony with former San Francisco Fed chief Alex Mehran.

title: Record stock rally faces risks from civil unrest, COVID-19, tech bubble
text: Big money managers are growing concerned that civil unrest could upend the stock market rally, but remain more worried about the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a Bank of America survey conducted in November.
